com.salesmanager.shop.store.controller.customer.facade

Class CustomerFacadeImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesmanager.shop.store.controller.customer.facade.CustomerFacadeImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CustomerFacade

    @Service(value="customerFacade")
public class CustomerFacadeImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements CustomerFacade
    Customer Facade work as an abstraction layer between Controller and Service layer. It work as an entry point to service layer.
    Author:
    Umesh Awasthi

      • mergeCart

        public com.salesmanager.core.model.shoppingcart.ShoppingCart mergeCart(com.salesmanager.core.model.customer.Customer customerModel,
                                                                       java.lang.String sessionShoppingCartId,
                                                                       com.salesmanager.core.model.merchant.MerchantStore store,
                                                                       com.salesmanager.core.model.reference.language.Language language)
                                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: CustomerFacade

        Method responsible for merging cart during authentication, Method will perform following operations

      • Merge Customer Shopping Cart with Session Cart if any.
      • Convert Customer to CustomerEntity

Specified by:
mergeCart in interface CustomerFacade
Parameters:
customerModel - username of Customer
sessionShoppingCartId - session shopping cart, if user already have few items in Cart.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

  • checkIfUserExists

    public boolean checkIfUserExists(java.lang.String userName,
                                 com.salesmanager.core.model.merchant.MerchantStore store)
                          throws java.lang.Exception

    Method to check if given user exists for given username under given store. System treat username as unique for a given store, customer is not allowed to use same username twice for a given store, however it can be used for different stores.

    Specified by:
    checkIfUserExists in interface CustomerFacade
    Parameters:
    userName - Customer slected userName
    store - store for which customer want to register
    Returns:
    boolean flag indicating if user exists for given store or not
    Throws:
    java.lang.Exception
